name: atypically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is different from what is normal or usual, or from all others of the same type: On that day my student was atypically talkative, which led me to believe he was anxious about something. The weather that day was atypically cold for early June.
More examplesFewer examplesHis last film is atypically slow and dull, especially when compared to the tightly edited, action-packed fare he is known for putting out. The one day that she was atypically late for class happened to be the day we were given a surprise quiz by the teacher.
